basics.name: Ethan Coe-Renner
basics.label: Computer Science Undergraduate
basics.summary: Motivated Computer Science undergraduate with interests ranging from low level systems programming to high level data analysis programming. Currently seeking a summer internship in computing for the summer of 2022.

work.name: University of the Pacific
work.summary: Tutor peers in classes including: Discrete Mathematics, Computing Theory, and Digital Design

courses: COMP 047 - Discrete Math for Comp Science

awards.title: Eagle Scout
awards.summary: I earned my Eagle Scout as the culmination of 10 years in the scouting program. I served in many leadership positions during those years, managing service projects, planning events, and teaching younger scouts in these roles.

awards.title: Regent's Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded by UOP for academic excellence.

projects.name: Teeny Tiny Compiler
projects.description: A compiler for teeny tiny, a programming language I created, in part following a tutorial. Includes a lexer, parser, and emitter written entirely in Rust.

projects.name: Genetic Dots
projects.description: A genetic algorithm for pathfinding around obstacles. Generates a random population of dots on which a genetic algorithm is used to optimize their paths.

projects.name: Rustbar (The Second One)
projects.description: A status bar written for use in the spectrwm window manager. Accesses linux system information to display network, battery, volume, etc.

projects.name: Three Coloring
projects.description: A rust program to convert a three coloring problem (graph theory) into a satisfiability problem (SAT).
